meanings.definition: Giving a false or misleading account of something.
meanings.sent1: The misrepresentative advertisement led to confusion among customers.
meanings.sent2: Her misrepresentative statement about the product's benefits was quickly debunked.
meanings.sent3: The misrepresentative description of the event made everyone laugh at the exaggeration.
meanings.sent4: His misrepresentative painting of the landscape distorted reality in a fascinating way.
meanings.sent5: The misrepresentative report painted a completely inaccurate picture of the situation.

meanings.definition: Tending to give a false or misleading impression.
meanings.sent1: The misrepresentative statistics skewed the results of the study.
meanings.sent2: His misrepresentative behavior made it hard to trust his intentions.
meanings.sent3: The misrepresentative movie poster made the film seem like a comedy when it was a drama.
meanings.sent4: Her misrepresentative smile hid the sadness she was feeling inside.
meanings.sent5: The misrepresentative cover of the book misled readers about its genre.
